Write a short summary about the passage below. Sweatshops are factories or other manufacturing facilities where workers are subjected to fetid, unhealthy, and unsafe working conditions and are paid very low wages. Sweatshops have been around for centuries, first appearing in Europe during the Industrial Revolution of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, but they were especially prevalent in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries in the United States. These factories were often characterized by cramped, overcrowded and unsanitary environments, with very few safety measures in place.

Summarize the passage using the most relevant information: 

The Amazon rainforest is home to more than 40,000 species of plants and animals, many of which are still undiscovered. It is the largest and oldest rainforest in the world, occupying more than 5.5 million square kilometres of land. The Amazon rainforest contains 90-140 billion metric tons of carbon, and is a crucial part of our global climate system.
